summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 6936, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Nineteenth Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from Yesler Way to East Marion Street, by constructing cement sidewalks, and wooden curbs, gutters and crosswalks, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
